Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2009 04:44AM jackiebrown wrote: Well the Mylanta and moving seemed to make a difference, I'm feeling some relief today. For some reason I assumed I would be feeling just fine within 2-3 days, obviously it was an unrealistic expectation. It was certainly easier than my bilat 2 years ago but more difficult than I thought. My path reports should be in later this week, but the surgeon made me somewhat nervous when he said my cysts were complex and more suspicious than he thought, he also added we have to find out if it's invasive or not but never actually directly stated it's cancer. Hopefully it's nothing more than a reaction to tamoxifen. Thank you again everyone for your comments and support!!
Posts.Title: Ooph recovery help !! jackiebrown mradf

Posts.Content: jackiebrown wrote: I had a D&C and my left ovary removed on thursday. I know it is supposed to be an easy surgery and recovery but I'm experiencing quite a bit of discomfort due to a bloated tummy and gas. Does anyone have any advice? I can't seem to find a comfortable position and have switched to tylenol only in case the pain meds were making my tummy situation worse. I would appreciate any advice. Dx 5/29/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 2/8 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ooph recovery help !! jackiebrown mradf

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2009 03:53PM jackiebrown wrote: Thank you for your responses. I've read so many posts that say the laproscopy and recovery were easy and I started to think I was alone in my discomfort. I went through my medicine cabinet and found a bottle of mylanta, hopefully it will help.
Posts.Title: Ooph recovery help !! jackiebrown mradf

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2009 02:02AM jackiebrown wrote: I just had my path reports, everything was benign!! Looks like I get to keep my other ovary and uterus for the time being at least. The next step is to decide what to do about my medication since it seems this was all a result of tamoxifen. I am 42yrs old, was premenopausal (before chemo), and have been on tamoxifen for one year. Ideally my breast oncologist wanted me to stay on tamox for another year but now thinks I should move directly to an aromotase inhibitor. My gyne onc prefers me to stay on tamox for a while longer. Any advice?
Posts.Title: Ooph recovery help !! jackiebrown mradf

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2009 05:10PM jackiebrown wrote: Thanks everyone, I'm sticking with tamoxifen and will have regular vaginal ultrasounds to monitor my remaining ovary and uterine lining. Your comments and feedback have been so helpful, I really appreciate it !!!
Posts.Title: Ooph recovery help !! jackiebrown mradf

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2007 08:56PM jackiebrown wrote: Dear twogirls, I agree with newbie, get a second opinion. I am 41yrs old and have 3 young boys, when I was diagnosed I first had a lumpectomy and was then told I needed a mast. At that point I sought a second opinion and switched surgeons. I ended up doing a bilat and chose expanders then silicone implants. You certainly will have more options for a symmetrical reconstruction result if you do a bilat, and of course the peace of mind regarding bc in the other breast is huge!
Posts.Title: BRCA test impact on surgery twogirls SandyinSoCal

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2007 07:13PM jackiebrown wrote: I think it varies from person to person. My hair started growing in just before my final taxol. I shaved my head again a few days after my final taxol and 4 weeks later had about half a centimeter of fairly even hair regrowth. It is fine and really soft, feels nice
